monarch/lord/gentleman/ruler
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
Junshan district of Yueyang city 岳陽|岳阳[Yue4 yang2], Hunan

sentences.english: Oh, yeah, Daniel, did you see all the sights of the Tongjun Mountain?
sentences.chinese: 对了，大牛，这桐君山你转完啦？

sentences.english: The mountain that is to the east of Pingtan is called Jun Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 位于平潭东部的那座山叫君山。

sentences.english: With regard to the origin of Junshan, there is a mythical story.
sentences.chinese: 关于君山的起源，有一个神话般的故事。

sentences.english: The island is also famous for its Junshan Yinzhen tea.
sentences.chinese: 该岛也是著名的君山银珍茶。

sentences.english: Firstly, the paper studied the consumption status and the predicting of rural life energy in Laojunshan area.
sentences.chinese: 老君山地区农村生活能源消费状况及预测研究。

sentences.english: Laojunshan Shennongjia in the north-east peak.
sentences.chinese: 老君山在神农架主峰东北。

sentences.english: Laojunshan area at the "Yangtze River Bay, " the West Bank.
sentences.chinese: 老君山景区位于“长江第一湾”西岸。

sentences.english: Shilin Pinnacle Laojunshan, Northland landscapes take Luoyang.
sentences.chinese: 石林叠翠老君山，北国山水走洛阳。
